content.rendered:
The details pertaining to the geographical coverage is as follows:-

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sl.No

 

 

States

 

 

Partner Banks

 

 

Current Status

 

 

Operational Districts

 

 

1

 

 

Andhra Pradesh

 

 

Allahabad Bank, Andhra Pragathi Gramin Bank

 

 

More than 1500 BCAs are employed to disburse money earmarked for NREGS & Social Security Pensions to over 3 million beneficiaries. Disbursed more than 800 Crores government money till date.

 

 

Anantapur, Cuddapah, Chittor, Guntur, Kurnool, Ongole, Nellore, West & East Godavari, Srikakulam

 

 

2

 

 

Assam

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India, HDFC Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in over 5000 villages. Over 15 Lakh no-frills accounts are opened till date and transactions commenced in over 1000 villages. BCA recruitment is underway in over 500 villages.

 

 

All Districts

 

 

3

 

 

Bihar

 

 

Bihar Gramin Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India, Punjab National Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in over 2500 Villages. More than 5 Lakh accounts are opened till date and transactions are underway in over 1000 villages.

 

 

Aurangabad, Banka, Begusarai, Bhagalur, Bhojpur, Gaya, Gopalgunj, Khagaria, Madhubani, Munger, Purnia, Sahasra, Rohtas, Kaimur, Nawada, Lakhisarai, Nalanda, Muzzaffarpur, Samastipur, Darbhanga

 

 

4

 

 

Chhattisgarh

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India, HDFC Bank

 

 

 

 

 

Got a mandate to work in over 200 villages and BCA selection is underway

 

 

Bastar, Bijapur, Bilaspur, Korba, Kanker, Durg, Jashpur, Raigarh, Rajnandgaon, Raipur, Surajpur, Sukma, Mahasamund

 

 

 

 

 

5

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Jharkhand

 

 

 

 

 

UCO Bank, United Bank of India

 

 

 Got a mandate to work in over 1000 villages and over 3 Lakh no-frills accounts are opened till date. Banking transactions are happening in over 400 villages.

 

 

Garhwa, Palamu, Hazaribagh, Koderma, Giridih, Ramgarh, Bokaro, Dhanbad, Lohardaga, Gumla, Ranchi, Khunti, West Singhbhum, East Singhbhum, Deoghar, Dumka.

 

 

 

 

 

6

 

 

Karnataka

 

 

Karnataka Gramin Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in over 500 villages and 5 Lakh Accounts are opened till date. Banking transactions are happening in over 300 villages.

 

 

Bagalkot, Gadag, Belgaum, Dharwad, Haveri, Uttar Kannada, Dakshin Kanataka

 

 

 

 

 

7

 

 

 

 

 

Meghalaya

 

 

 

 

 

UCO Bank, United Bank of India, HDFC Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in over 500 villages and BCA selection is underway

 

 

West Jaintia Hills, East Jaintia Hills, East Khasi Hills, West Khasi Hills, North Garo Hills, East Garo Hills, South Garo Hills

 

 

8

 

 

Odisha

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India

 

 

Got a mandate to work in2500 villages and more than 10 Lakh Accounts are opened till date. Banking transactions are happening in over 300 villages.

 

 

Anugul, Boudh, Bhadrak, Balangir, Bargarh, Balasore, Cuttack, Dhenkanal, Ganjam, Gajapati, Jajapur, Jagatsinghapur, Khordha, Keonjhar, Koraput, Kendrapara, Mayurbhanj, Nabarangpur, Nuapada, Nayagarh, Puri, Sambalpur, Sundergarh.

 

 

9

 

 

Tripura

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India

 

 

Got a mandate to work in 100 villages and more than 1.5 Lakh no-frills accounts   are opened. 200+ Crores earmarked for NREGS & Pension Payments is disbursed to the beneficiaries

 

 

All Districts

 

 

 

 

 

10

 

 

 

 

 

Uttar Pradesh

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India, Punjab National Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in more than 400 villages in western UP. Opened more   than 2.5 Lakh no-frills accounts and transactions are under progress.

 

 

Agra, Badaun, Bareilly, Shahjahanpur, Bulandshahr, Ghaziabad, Meerut, Varanasi, Muzaffarnagar, Saharanpur, Lucknow, Raebareli

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

11

 

 

Uttaranchal

 

 

 

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India

 

 

 

 

 

Got a mandate to work in more than 400 villages. Opened more than 2 Lakh no-frills accounts and transactions are under progress in over 100 villages

 

 

Almora, Bageshwar, Chamoli, Dehradun, Nainital, Pauri Garhwal, Tehri Garhwal, Udham Singh Nagar

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

12

 

 

West Bengal

 

 

Allahabad Bank, UCO Bank, United Bank of India, Paschim Bengal Gramin Bank

 

 

Got a mandate to work in more than 16500 villages. More than 40 Lakh no-frills accounts are opened and transactions are underway in over 6000 villages

 

 

All Districts

 

 

 

 

 



    The roles and responsibilities of Gram Tarang apart from acting as an interface of Bank and the TSP are as follows:-
      · To manage the entire infrastructure provided for execution of the Financial Inclusion project including the Laptops, handheld devices, enrollment system, digital fingerprint scanners, digital cameras etc. Gram Tarang will be the custodian for the infrastructure provided for operations and responsible for any damage not within the normal wear and tear of the hardware.

      · To operate entire infrastructure including the enrollment systems, handheld devices as per the training given by the TSP and by the Bank for providing services to its customers.

      · To deploy well defined operational procedures and should ensure protection of TSP and the Bank from operational risk / transaction risk (human error, negligence and mismanagement) and fraud risk (loss to earnings or capital due to intentional deception by employees, customers, Business Correspondent Agents (BCAs), external entities, etc).

      · To take due care to deploy sufficient manpower so as not to cause disruptions to services to the customers by deploying back up manpower.

      · To provide access to its systems to TSP internal audit team, Bank’s internal audit teams and third-party external auditors including from Reserve Bank of India, for conducting periodical audit of the records, data, documents, transactions and other necessary information, related to this Project, within a reasonable period of time.

      · To maintain a robust and customizable MIS to meet the requirements of TSP and the Bank.

      · To extend all of the outsourced banking and financial services by deploying such personnel those have high integrity and meet the qualifications and other criteria stipulated by the Reserve Bank of India, Government or the Bank from time to time. The nature of services will be informed to Gram Tarang by TSP from time to time as per instructions received from the Bank.

      · To serve as the “Pass through Agents” for offering specified technical / banking and non-banking products on behalf of the Bank or any other organization approved by the Bank and function as per the directions and under the control and guidance of the Bank. Gram Tarang shall report to the Bank in so far as financial / banking / non-banking products are concerned.
